body:
* Bug Report

currently make vendor complains about:

```
=== checking if vendor deps changed
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/coreos/pkg"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/ghodss/yaml"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/go-ini/ini"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/go-sql-driver/mysql"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/google/uuid"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/gorilla/mux"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/icrowley/fake"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/jbw976/go-ps"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/prometheus/client_golang"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/spf13/cobra"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/spf13/pflag"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "github.com/stretchr/testify"
dep: WARNING: branch, version, revision, or source should be provided for "k8s.io/utils"
=== vendor deps have not changed
```

**Deviation from expected behavior:**

**Expected behavior:**

there should not be any warnings.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
make vendor.check

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod):
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift):
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/Rook/master/toolbox.html)):
title: make sure all vendor dependencies have constraints
